result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremiah Paul Potter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Counts 1 and 2 are concurrent.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to be determined within 30 days.
To be set at $110.00 if no worksheet filed and payable through Probation.
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF176.

Restitution Worksheet. Signed by EJL. Fax: DOC. km
c: DOC. eif
c: Def, Atty, DA, SCSO and E: Probation. eif

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Jeremiah Paul Potter appeared. Atty Kucinski recites agreement. Court amends to count one to misdemeanor theft, 943.20(1a); and adds count two to misdemeanor receiveing stolen property, 934.34. Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for AMENDED, count one - misd. theft and count two - misd. receiving stolen property. Def pleads no contest to both counts. Court uses complaints/reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates def guilty of count 1, as amended and count 2. Court orders: S/W 1 year probation with conditions: (Counts 1 & 2 are concurrent)
- Restitution to be determined within 30 days. To be set at $110.00 if no worksheet filed. 
- Count 1 court costs $243.00. Payable through probation
- Count 2 DNA surcharge $200.00. Payable through probation
Defendant is advised of right to appeal.
filed by ADA Alexis McKinley. eif
Pre-trial conference on November 14, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski, DF:  Jermiah Paul Potter appeared. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing. Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Bond continues and address is confirmed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 14, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

per Defendant's bond. eif
Pre-trial conference on July 25, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,   Burleigh L.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Def understands.  Waives reading.  Prelim demanded. Waive speedy prelim. Defendant to call in with corrected address by end of day tomorrow 5/30/14.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 25, 2014 at 09:00 am.
